do you remember, the 21 night of september
Yes! That line is from the song "September" by Earth, Wind & Fire. It's a classic hit celebrating joyful memories and good times. Do you have any particular thoughts or questions about the song?

The specific date of September 21st in the song "September" by Earth, Wind & Fire isn't explicitly explained by the songwriters, which has led to various interpretations and speculations among listeners. It's often viewed as a symbolic date associated with a joyful and significant moment, capturing the essence of nostalgia and celebration.

Some fans believe the date represents a personal memory for the band members, while others see it as an arbitrary choice that effectively conveys the song's themes of happiness and cherishing good times. Ultimately, the date contributes to the song's catchy and memorable essence, inviting listeners to reflect on their own cherished moments.
what song goes bababa baba bababa

The "bababa" refrain is reminiscent of the song "The Boxer" by Simon & Garfunkel, particularly in the chorus, where the "lie-la-lie" parts can sound similar. Another popular song with a "ba ba ba" motif is "Hey Jude" by The Beatles during the "na-na-na" part. If you have a specific genre or context in mind, I can help narrow it down further!
bye bye bye baby bye bye bye

The lyrics you mentioned are from "Bye Bye Bye" by *NSYNC. It's a well-known pop song that was released in 2000 and became one of the group's biggest hits. The song expresses a sense of moving on from a relationship. If you want to know more about the song or the group, feel free to ask!
